prompt: Facts: Marriage between Inder Singh (Accused No. 1) and the deceased, Rajbala, took place about one and a half years prior to the incident.; On 24.11.1988, Rajbala died by hanging in her matrimonial home in Village Sisana, District Rohtak, Haryana.; Raj Singh (PW-3), father of the deceased, lodged an FIR (Ex. P-A) on 25.11.1988 at Police Station Kharkhoda.; The FIR alleged that Inder Singh (husband), Rajinder Singh (brother-in-law, Accused No. 2), and Jasbir Singh (father-in-law, Accused No. 3) had been demanding dowry (fridge, scooter, cash) since the marriage.; It was alleged that due to non-fulfillment of demands, Rajbala was harassed and maltreated.; PW-3 stated that about 10-12 days before the incident, his son Satyavir (PW-4) had visited Rajbala, who complained about the continued harassment and demands.; PW-3 and PW-4 testified regarding specific demands and instances of harassment.; Post-mortem examination (report Ex. P-C) conducted by Dr. J.S. Punia (PW-1) concluded the cause of death was asphyxia due to hanging.; The Trial Court (Additional Sessions Judge, Rohtak) convicted all three accused under Sections 304B/34 and 498A/34 IPC, sentencing them to 7 years RI for 304B and 2 years RI + fine for 498A, sentences to run concurrently.; On appeal, the High Court of Punjab and Haryana upheld the convictions.; The High Court, however, reduced the sentence of Rajinder Singh and Jasbir Singh under Section 304B IPC from 7 years to 5 years RI, while maintaining Inder Singh's sentence.; Inder Singh (husband), Rajinder Singh (brother-in-law), and Jasbir Singh (father-in-law) appealed to the Supreme Court.; The Supreme Court noted the death occurred within 7 years of marriage under circumstances raising concerns about dowry harassment. | IPC: Section 304B (Dowry Death), Section 498A (Husband or relative of husband of a woman subjecting her to cruelty), Section 34 (Acts done by several persons in furtherance of common intention)
